chargeHist.descr: Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine
Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine

result.execSummary:
The defendant Clinton Thomas Graveen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:30 AM Defendant Clinton Thomas Graveen appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach appeared by video for Clinton Thomas Graveen.  Prosecuting attorney Kristopher R Ellis in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Case called appearances given.  Court was previously disqualified and the defense is going to waive the disqualification of Judge. Court leaves the courtroom to make any other kind of record.  All parties are in favor of waiving the disqualification. Judge is back on the bench at 9:32 am.  Court waived disqualification.  Defense waives the preliminary hearing  Court advises the deft as to his rights to a preliminary hearing FVI. Court finds probable cause

Deft enters a plea of no contest Count 6 remaining counts are 1-5 are DRI.  Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty. Voting rights and firearms warning was given by the court.

Court orders - Count 6
24 months probation withheld sentence - Count 6
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.  A payment plan can be set up with the Clerk's Of Courts for those assessments, fees and surcharges. If payments are not made, a civil judgement, with interest, may be ordered. 
AODA assessment and treatment to be decided by the agent
Absolute sobriety. Shall not consume or possess any controlled substances.  May take prescribed medications in the prescribed dosages. 
6 days sentence credit

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
2:23 PM - case called.  Defendant Clinton Thomas Graveen appeared by video, in custody from the Lincoln County Jail.  Attorney Jessica Fehrenbach appeared via Zoom, specially.  Attorney Andrew Polzin in court for State of Wisconsin.  State moves to adjourn this matter to file an amended criminal complaint.  Statement by Atty Fehrenbach - in receipt of complaint - waive reading - moves to dismiss Counts 3, 4 and 9.  Response by Atty Polzin.  Argument by State as to bond.  Court grants motion to dismiss Counts 3, 4 and 9.  Response by Atty Fehrenbach.  Court sets bond.  Atty Fehrenbach waives time limits for scheduling the preliminary hearing.  Court accepts the waiver of time limits.
Scheduling conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 11:00 am.
